content.description:
Start about 30 feet right of

The Song Remains the Same

on the right side of a chasm. Climb a steep crack system that ascends a groove.
content.protection: At least one bolt, trad gear.
content.location:
Start about 30 feet right of

The Song Remains the Same

on the right side of a chasm. This is about 70 feet right of the start of

Physical Graffiti

.

climbs.name: The Sound of One Hoof Knocking

content.description:
Crank up the juggy overhanging start to gain the left-slanting tight dihedral about 8 ft right of Ancestral Puebloans.  At the top, instead of finishing toward the back through a trivial awkward wide gap, more fun to veer up and left via a cupped hands crack toward the top of Ancestral Puebloans.

No documentation of this in any of the books.  Maybe done before, maybe not.  Might as well just give it a name.  Happy to update if FA info known.
content.protection: Cams to 3", gear anchor.  Easy walkoff to climber's right.

climbs.name: Physical Graffiti
climbs.fa: Pitch 1: (TR) Bob Gaines, Erik Murdoch, December 2004, Complete Route: Bob Gaines, Russell Romero, January 2005

content.description:
Best done in 2 short pitches, although you can lead it in one if you really watch out for rope drag, but then you'll miss out on the view from the cool cave belay and its natural rock seat!

The first pitch hand traverses up and right across a dike past 4 bolts to a belay alcove with 2 bolts. Pitch 2 traverses left, then up steeper face climbing to the top.(6 bolts and 2 fixed pins) Bolted belay/rap anchor. Rap 80 feet.

This is the prominent crack in the corner just left of Physical Graffiti. Mostly hand size to a brutal offwidth finish! There is a mushroom shaped rock at the base. You can rap from the bolts at the top of Physical Graffiti (80 feet).
content.protection: .75 to #5 camalot or equivalent (I used a 3.5, 4 , and 5 camalot at the widening top section)

content.description:
Top rope the very grainy flakes and features directly up to the first pitch anchor on

Physical Graffiti

.
content.location:
Start about 40 feet right of the start of

Physical Graffiti

, directly below the P1 anchor and left of a chasm.

content.description:
Climb the short, sunny crack that is just left of

Ancestral Puebloans

.
content.location:
Start just left of

Ancestral Puebloans

, which is about 300 feet left of

Mushroom Crack

and the main Anasazi Wall.

content.description:
Start about 300 feet left of

Mushroom Crack

where the terrace narrows. Climb a short, varnished face with one bolt.
content.location:
Walk left on the rock terrace from

Mushroom Crack

about 300 feet to a point where the terrace narrows. Directly above is a small, sunny face.
